llm.feedback: The draft meets the format but needs tighter alignment with the source: (1) revise the probability of the Fed‑cut‑driven DXY rise to 60 % (reflecting the 10–20 % upside in (1)(3) rather than 80 %); (2) adjust the crypto‑order‑driven DXY lift to 50 % (no numeric probability in (3) but a 10–20 % upside is implied); (3) merge the two “Fed minutes” down scenarios into one 89 % probability event (Fed minutes confirm a 25‑bp cut and steepen the 2‑yr/10‑yr spread, per (7XH2DKEKV)), and drop the 11 % “no‑cut” variant to avoid redundancy; (4) add the exact dates to the watch signals (e.g., “Fed minutes 2025‑09‑01, 2‑yr/10‑yr spread 2025‑09‑01”) so the trigger is explicit; (5) ensure each line remains a single sentence with no filler, e.g., “Up | 2025‑09‑16‑17 | Fed cut + crypto demand boost → DXY +0.5‑1 % (1)(3) | Watch Fed minutes 2025‑09‑01, crypto exec order 2025‑08‑09 (1)(3) | 60 %.” This will satisfy the evidence‑based, causal‑chain, and probability‑justification requirements.
